Package chess.model.player

Class Minimax1

java.lang.Object
chess.model.Colored
chess.model.player.Player
chess.model.player.Agent
chess.model.player.Minimax1
All Implemented Interfaces:
chess.persistence.Codable
public final class Minimax1 extends Agent
An implementation of the most basic N-depth Minimax Search autonomous Chess-playing agent with alpha-beta pruning.

This algorithm is shown to be very slow and resource inefficient given a search depth of N > 4 or even just a large search space.

This variant of the implementation also uses the most basic valuation mechanism possible, i.e. the agent, on any given search path:

  1. accumulates positive minimax value upon capturing an adversary's piece;
  2. accumulates negative minimax value upon its pieces being captured by the adversary.
The minimax value is the number of points associated with the captured piece. Except when the adversarial search reaches some terminal state (i.e. checkmate or stalemate), in which case a significant amount is added/deducted from the accumulated minimax value to incentivize/discourage to attempt a move that would likely result in mating the opponent/themselves. Note that the algorithm only awards a small amount for stalemating the opponent and does not impose significant punishment upon getting themselves stalemated.

    • Minimax1

      public Minimax1(String name, Color color, int score)
      Constructs this Minimax agent with a name, color, and an initial score.

      Note: The player's name must not be empty or contains spaces only.

      Parameters:
      name - The name of the agent.
      color - The color of the agent.
      score - The initial score of the agent.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If any of the arguments is null.
      FormatException - If the stripped name is empty or contains spaces only.
